觵字的基本解释

觵
gōng
古同“觥”。

觵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gōng］
［《廣韻》古横切，平庚，見。］
亦作“觵1”。
(1)盛酒或饮酒器。古代用兽角制，后也用木或青铜制。腹椭圆形或方形，底为圈足或四足。有流，有把手。盖作成带角的兽头形或长鼻上卷的象头形。也有整体作兽形的。有的觥内附有酌酒用的勺。盛行于商代和西周前期。
(2)大，丰盛。参见“觥羊”、“觥飯”。
(3)刚直貌。参见“觥觥”。
(4)壮健貌。参见“觥觥”。
(5)象声词。

觵字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【角字部】　觵； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1144第32
【說文】觥本字。

觵字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
觵字的起名意思

暂无。

Go
Basic explanation of words
Go
gōng
Ancient Tong "觥".
Go
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gōng］
["Guangyun" ancient crosscut, Pinggeng, see. ]
Also known as "觵1".
(1) Wine container or drinker. In ancient times, it was made of animal horns, and later it was also made of wood or bronze. The abdomen is oval or square, and the bottom is ring-footed or quadruped. There is flow, there are handles. The cover is made in the shape of a beast head with horns or an elephant head with a long nose rolled up. There are also animal-shaped ones as a whole. Some have a spoon for drinking inside. It prevailed in the Shang Dynasty and the early Western Zhou Dynasty.
(2) Big and rich. See "觥羊", "觥饭".
(3) Just look straight. See "觥觥".
(4) Robust appearance. See "觥觥".
(5) Onomatopoeia.
